import.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a product that is brought from one country into another so that it can be sold there, or the business of doing this
import.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: American demand for Japanese imports  (=goods from Japan)
import.translation[0].definitions[1].def: something new or different that is brought to a place where it did not previously exist
import.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: The beetle is thought to be a European import.
import.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: a matter of no great import
import.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: Foreign imports into Britain continued to grow in the 1970s.
Farmers are complaining about cheap imports flooding the market.
Japanese imports rose by 5% last year.
The country is dependent on oil imports for almost all its basic energy needs.
There is pressure on the country to reduce its rice imports.
Restrictions on agricultural imports remain in place.
The country had problems paying for its essential imports.
Higher duties were placed on luxury imports.
The company increased imports in order to cut domestic production costs.
New investment will reduce imports and save jobs.
The scheme aims to control imports of cheap goods.
The organization wants the government to ban imports of exotic birds.
Imports increased by 13 percent last year.
Imports of consumer goods fell sharply in December.
The US imposed an import ban on several types of fish.
Each country introduced its own import quotas.
The US imposed huge import duties on products from Europe.
import.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to bring a product from one country into another so that it can be sold there
import.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: In 2001, Britain exported more cars than it imported.
All the meat is imported from France.
import.translation[1].definitions[1].def: to introduce something new or different in a place where it did not previously exist
import.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: The unusual designs were probably imported from Iran.
The US comedy format was gradually imported to UK screens.
import.translation[1].definitions[2].def: to move information from one computer to another
import.translation[1].definitions[2].exa: You can now import graphics from other applications.
import.translation[2].definitions[0].def: something that is made in one country and brought into another, usually in order to be sold there
import.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: The shops are full of cheap imports.
import.translation[2].definitions[1].def: the activity of bringing goods into a country
import.translation[2].definitions[1].exa: US regulations on the import of four-wheel drive vehicles
a ban on imports of exotic birds
A slowdown in Japan’s domestic economy led to a sharp decline in imports of luxury cars.
import.translation[2].definitions[2].def: the amount or value of the goods brought into a country over a particular period of time
import.translation[2].definitions[2].exa: With a strong dollar, US exports will continue to decline and imports will rise.
import.translation[3].definitions[0].def: to bring something into a country from abroad, usually in order to sell it
import.translation[3].definitions[0].exa: We must reduce the country’s dependence on imported oil.
Bees were imported from Africa in an effort to improve honey production.
These raw materials are all imported into Korea, as there are no local producers.
import.translation[3].definitions[1].def: to move information from one computer or software program into another
import.translation[3].definitions[1].exa: You can either type your data into this form or you can import data from a spreadsheet.
